intro: Krigia oppositifolia, commonly known as the oppositeleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite in arrangement, which is a key identifying feature. Krigia oppositifolia is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
